greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Lexicographically earliest sequence such that for all i, j, a(i) = a(j) => f(i) = f(j) where f(n) = A325563(n) except f(1) = 0.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
program: rgs_transform(invec) = { my(om = Map(), outvec = vector(length(invec)), u=1); for(i=1, length(invec), if(mapisdefined(om,invec[i]), my(pp = mapget(om, invec[i])); outvec[i] = outvec[pp] , mapput(om,invec[i],i); outvec[i] = u; u++ )); outvec; };
A325563(n) = if(1==n,n, my(p = Pol(binary(n))*Mod(1, 2)); fordiv(n,d,if((d>1),my(q = Pol(binary(n/d))*Mod(1, 2)); if(0==(p%q), return(n/d)))));
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, May 11 2019
